website_summaries.verdict: An easy to clean, dishwasher-safe pan at a bargain price.
pros: Silicone pan holds its shape well, even after multiple uses
Flexibility makes cleanup simple and quick when hand washing, but pan is also dishwasher safe
Deep cups produce high, fluffy popovers that pop out of the pan with ease
cons: Silicone pan does require an additional baking sheet to provide balance in the oven

customer_reviews.title: Excellent muffin-top pan
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pan for a few months and have made muffin tops every two weeks. I use a light coat of shortening on the tray to assure easy removal of the cooked muffin tops (as recommended in the literature that came with the pan) and it works wonderfully. The pan is super easy to clean and easy to store. It's necessary to have a cookie sheet underneath the pan to move it about and put it into and take it out of the oven as the pan is thoroughly flexible and will not stay flat unless supported from below. If you like muffin tops, this is a great pan to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: Great for toaster rounds!
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my recreation of toaster cornbread rounds! The only draw back was some slight sticking. I am experimenting with different oils to see if it resolves. Would buy again! Tip: place on a cookie sheet to take to oven to slide it in/out.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Smells while using it
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed about the smell of this after baking with it. I bought the mini muffin tray, washed it by hand and used it. It smells like gross rubber. The smell lingers on the food. And I can definitely smell it directly from the tray itself. Gross. Doesn't seem safe to be eating off of. What a waste of time making my muffins, baking, only to find out I have to throw everything out. Ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: G. Lin

customer_reviews.title: This is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is not nonstick. My eggs stuck in the muffin cups, even with nonstick spray being used as well. If is also very difficult to clean, as the food did not want to come off. I would recommend saving your money and buying another brand. My Aldi's silicone pans were way cheaper and much higher quality. I had to give a star rating, or else I would have left it blank.
customer_reviews.author: MMatthews

customer_reviews.title: There's no way that this is a jumbo muffin pan ...
customer_reviews.text: There's no way that this is a jumbo muffin pan. It's just little bit bigger than the regular size muffin pan I have and is no where close in size to the jumbo muffin pan I just threw out to replace with this one. I wished I had bought something else. For the price I paid I thought it would be what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: EJA's Nana

customer_reviews.title: Can you say Sausage, Egg and Cheese English Muffins?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make the egg rounds for Sausage Egg and Cheese breakfast sandwiches. This is a little wider than the english muffins, but the best thing i can find to make a whole tray of them so i can freeze the sandwiches for daily use. PRO TIP: Put herbs in your eggs while they bake for extra flavor!
customer_reviews.author: kenny

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR SMOOTHIE INGREDIENTS LIKE KALE!
customer_reviews.text: This Mini Muffin Pan works PERFECT for taking fresh kale and/or spinach, (which used to go bad before I could eat them), pulverizing them with water in my NutriBullet, and then spooning them into this mini muffin pan, (which I've put on top of a cookie sheet for stability), to FREEZE. When frozen, they easily pop out for storing in a freezer bag. I put these perfect little frozen kale "muffins" along with other nutritious ingredients like berries into my NutriBullet for smoothies for a healthy snack. No more throwing out the healthy GREENS!!
customer_reviews.author: Lady of Leisure

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: What a great little muffin maker. I made my first peanut butter cups and this muffin pan worked perfectly! My husband asked me if I greased the pan first which I did not. What a great moment when I removed them as they slid right out. No need to grease this pan! I love silicone for many different uses and now a adding a muffin pan helps to make everything easier. High quality, easy to use and such a pretty color!
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sizes for what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of this pan, as it fits in my Cuisinart Chef's Convection Toaster Oven so I can bake individual meatloaves, sourdough buns, upside-down pineapple cakes, etc. easily! The size of the 6 cups are perfect. It has a high temp tolerance and cleans up nicely, although not perfectly. I have bought two of these and use them often.
customer_reviews.author: Patrice J.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have used to to make chick pea based omelets in the oven. I wanted them to be a standard size to make breakfast sandwiches. They do do that fine. They do not release as easily as I thought they would based on some of my other silicone baking ware.
customer_reviews.author: L. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT muffin top!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pan for muffin tops as I always enjoy the tops more and my 16 month old son makes less of a mess when eating the tops ;-) On my first time use, they came out PERFECT! Just a little PAM spray to bake and and an easy clean up. Due to the silicone pan being light weight, when baking, it is recommended to place on cookie sheet for easier transport to/into the oven. I will be ordering another one so I can make 12 at a time!
customer_reviews.author: Peter McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely no sticking!!
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love this silicone muffin top pan. NO matter what I put in it, nothing sticks! I know it says you can put it in the dishwasher, but I am careful with my stuff so I have only hand washed mine. Seriously, it only takes a minute in warm soapy water! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: LJM

customer_reviews.title: Highly durable and good results
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for several years and it still looks like new. I use this for making muffins and mini omelets. I'm very happy with how evenly they cook and how easy it is to clean (it's dishwasher safe) If you are not familiar with silicone bakeware then note that it's floppy and so need to be set on a baking tray when being moved around.
customer_reviews.author: Tori P.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The best part of a muffin is the top. This pan is perfect at cooking tops. A bit of a learning curve. After several attempts, each filled a little deeper we found that it is best to fill the cups all the way to the top. A standard box of Krusteaz muffin mix will make 6 wonderful muffin tops. They pop out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Wondering

customer_reviews.title: These work amazingly well and are easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I love these muffin pans. I bought one, and then a year later bought another one. I still use a small amount of shortening to coat the pan, otherwise it is pretty impossible to remove the muffins, but I still love these. I find that baking with silicone I need to raise my oven temp by 25 degrees in order for items to be done in the same amount of time as metal tins. Nice alternative to paper muffin cups and scrubbing metal tins.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Almost right
customer_reviews.text: We cook eggs in this for breakfast sandwiches. I haven't used it for anything else but it works great for that purpose! It's just the right shape for sandwich bread or an english muffin. My only complaint is that it's not sturdy if I try to lift it with anything in it, it spills out so I have to put it on a pan...
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Hey muffin😉
customer_reviews.text: I use these all the time!! So great not only for muffins but meatloaf and egg cups because it is so easy to clean. I Do put on a cookie sheet in the oven for more stability. Edit: as time goes, these don’t come as clean as I’d like - stains from baked on food I guess:(
customer_reviews.author: M Stone

customer_reviews.title: Love this...
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are on the Keto diet, he is more into it than I, but I support and go along with him, one of the best recipes, that he makes, is his mini cauliflower pizzas and chocolate chip macaroons. Nothing sticks and cooks evenly
customer_reviews.author: best game ever

customer_reviews.title: The tops are the best part
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. I like baking with silicone because of how easy it is to work with. I need to put this on a cookie sheet to keep it sturdy, but that is not a big deal. Everything else about this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: VERY happy with this.
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned by some reviews that said it was difficult to remove the muffins after baking, or difficulty cleaning the pan after use. I encountered neither. The muffins dropped out when I flipped the pan, and after soaking for 5 minutes the pan cleaned up easily. When I first got the pan I was worried because the cup size looked smaller than the metal one I already had. But I baked the same packages of muffin mix in this pan that I used with my metal one and the cups in this pan were more than enough to handle the amount of mix. VERY happy with this pan. Will try some other similar products from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ringenberg

customer_reviews.title: Could not be more happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: One of my most used items in the kitchen. I make these keto cheesebuns from a recipe i found on IG with this pan and they come out perfect everytime! I wish the pan was a bit easier to clean, but i think that's a fault of silicone, not this particular pan itself. Overall, i love it so much and am so happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: AriesDoc

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have used it to bake keto english muffins. I had a metal one that began to peal. That's when I went for this silicone. Works well. I usually place it on a cook sheet just so it won't bend when I take it out of the overn.
customer_reviews.author: Diane G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Just what I was looking for to make eggs for my breakfast sandwiches. Whisking the eggs before putting them in the pan makes them easier to remove. Each circle can hold two large eggs! Easy clean up because it's non stick!
customer_reviews.author: tadi

customer_reviews.title: To big for cooking eggs for muffin sandwiches
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed. I have a Chicago metal muffin top pan and it's the perfect size to cook eggs for egg muffin sandwiches. It would take 2 eggs per muffin area to use this pan. I'm going to look for someone to give this to because it's useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Corry G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I looked in Bed Bath & Beyond, WalMart, etc. for this muffin top pan. I use it to make Keto breakfast cookies. The cookies are easily removed (I spray the pan with coconut oil) and clean up is a snap! I put the muffin top pan on a cookie sheet for easy removal from the oven.
customer_reviews.author: your signature

customer_reviews.title: Makes excellent muffin frittata
customer_reviews.text: I took my go-to frittata recipe and added it to this silicone muffin pan versus the traditional frittata pie plate. Easy to bake. Easy to portion. Yum! Great for wrapping individual portions for work meals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the size of muffin these produce!
customer_reviews.text: Making lots of banana bread so bought these to change it up a bit. I didn't want the typical small muffin sizes so this produces a nice larger size muffin - and the silicon is of a nice quality. Stable, easy to clean, and you do not need liners if you don't have any. They come out very easily
customer_reviews.author: AI

customer_reviews.title: Baking was a breeze with the muffin top pan
customer_reviews.text: I have used this muffin baking pan twice since I purchased it to make individual breads and I love it. Baked goods pop out when done and clean up is so easy afterwards. It was shipped out and received quickly and I am happy with my purchase. I would recommend it happily.
customer_reviews.author: dede b

customer_reviews.title: Egg McMuffin made easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this muffin top pan to use to make baked eggs for home made egg McMuffin style sandwiches. It works perfectly! I like it better than a regular muffin tins as the egg size is more appropriate for sandwiches.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as far a easy to release without sticking
customer_reviews.text: Perfect as far a easy to release without sticking, but you ABSOLUTELY must put on a cookie sheet before filling. This is my first experience with a silicon muffin pan so do not know if this is a generic issue. Popovers came out high and fluffy as they should.
customer_reviews.author: dijit

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make egg muffins for a quick and easy breakfast. I even forgot to grease the cups before pouring in the egg and they came out perfectly clean, no sticking!! Super easy to clean. This is so much better than a metal pan!
customer_reviews.author: Kimber

customer_reviews.title: Works great and it's easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: We haven't actually used this for muffins yet but we will some day. It is flexible so be prepared to put it on a metal pan to steady it. I think that would be even more important with something bready and fragile like muffins. We actually use this to cook meatballs after watching Alton Brown do it on one of his shows. The juices and cooked on bits clean off easily and this keeps the meatballs round while letting the juices drain away. It's a great idea and I'm glad I got this pan to do it instead of a metal one.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Does exactly what it says it will. Yup: Best to use a sheet pan under it in the oven, to make it easier to remove. Very pleased with the quality and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Nia S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this. So easy to remove baked item. I used this for a layered ice cream recipe and they popped out perfectly for individual frozen desserts. Have also baked with this item and cake popped out easily. Also an easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Lorra

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: When I make jumbo meatloaf muffins, these work perfectly! Plenty of room to keep the great contained, but easy to clean up once you pop those puppies out. I would buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Large cups. Bigger than I expected, and that's a good thing. They're about the size of the large muffins you can buy at the store, perhaps a little larger. It's real silicone, not that hybrid crap. It passed the Pinch test.
customer_reviews.author: Giest

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to make egg sandwiches!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to make egg sandwiches (brioche buns). We have to put a metal pan under it to be able to take in/out of oven. The eggs are perfect size for sandwiches and baked nicely. Sometimes my eggs stick, so be sure to spray before use! We love doing this at home instead of getting sandwiches in the drive thru as we save a lot of money!
customer_reviews.author: The Zon Customer1001

customer_reviews.title: Great for rolls and buns too.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Be sure to use a flat sheet pan under it. Makes great rolls, cats head baking powder biscuits, and hamburger buns too
customer_reviews.author: William McCarver

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the HIC Brands that Cook Essentials Silicone 12-Cup Muffin Pan to use both for cooking and freezing individual portions of foods. It has worked extremely well both for hot and frozen foods. I am saving money on my grocery bill because items like greek yogurt and hummus can be individually frozen and defrosted as I need them. No more waste due to food spoilage. The muffin pan is also great for preparing individual crustless quiches, which after baking can also be frozen. The flexibility of the silicone makes the contents pop out easily. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sari S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice silcone pan
customer_reviews.text: I have always sprayed the muffin pan before using it and I have had no trouble with sticking. I have used this muffin pan to make various kinds of muffins as well as mini cheesecakes. Ideally, I would like to use it without having to spray it, but I haven't yet done that. Maybe I'll try it with some cupcakes knowing that I might end up making cakeballs if I end up with a mess. You do have to use 2 hands when putting the pan in the oven and removing it because of the flexibility of the silicone, so make sure you go to the oven with oven mitts.
customer_reviews.author: P. Garvin

customer_reviews.title: muffintops, toasties, and cookies
customer_reviews.text: The instructions suggest you use on top of cookie sheet. (I'm responding to any negative reviews) I am now ready to make corn toasties, yummy muffin tops, and breakfast cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Jumbo-sized muffins
customer_reviews.text: For some reason I was expecting a pan for normal-sized muffins.... these are enormous, and there is no taper to the bases at all (I should have taken a better look at the picture). That being said, the pan is great for personal-sized quiches and frittatas. This hasn't had vigorous use, but seems pretty tough. It's nice to be able to push items out instead of trying to gently pry them out with a knife. Overall it's not what I expected, but it's not bad.
customer_reviews.author: hauntfox

customer_reviews.title: Easy egg sandwiches and easy clean!
customer_reviews.text: Great for making eggs for egg sandwiches. Needs to sit on another tray to cook but so easy to clean and remove the egg.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Exactly As Ordered
customer_reviews.text: The product was exactly like the seller described and it arrived in a timely manner. I'm going vegan and when I saw this product, I just had to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in Mrs
customer_reviews.text: Stronge odor- ew! When I opened the box, the house filled with the odor of a cheap scented candle. I could not eat in the same room as the muffin tray. Washed it in hot soapy water- still stank- so sent it through dishwasher. Odor was reduced but still present. Cannot be safe to cook in stinky pans so returned. Very disappointed in Mrs. Anderson's Silicone muffin pan.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: 24 mini cups
customer_reviews.text: I got the 24 mini cups and I love it! Make sure you get 2 as they are super small but great for brownies for a large crowd or even little quiche. I like it because it makes my dessert look like a lot and keeps it in better portions for a large group. I will probably be ordering another 1 or 2 of these... they are really useful. Also, a lot nicer if you don't have much storage room. My cabinets are really skinny, I can fold this into the cabinet rather than messing with a pan.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Non-stick, cooks evenly and easy clean up. You will need to put a regular baking pan under it because it doesn't have structure to support itself. But it's so easy to work with. I've used mine in the oven and have used it to freeze cream cheese bites. Very versatile. I always use a little butter or coconut oil in mine before use and it Cleans up beautifully. I haven't used cooking spray because I've seen the residue that can leave on my regular pans and I wanted to keep this looking nice.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzi - Florida

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  I want to get another!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this to make keto biscuits. Easy to use. Non stick. Great size. Would like to have one with 8-count.
customer_reviews.author: gmw

customer_reviews.title: works well- muffins came right out
customer_reviews.text: I finally used this muffin pan. I put it on a cooky sheet, as other reviewers mentioned. It worked- corn muffins didn't stick, even though I didn't notice the instructions to oil the pan before using it and before each baking. After washing it I oiled it, but then wiped most of the oil off since I use cold pressed oils that I keep refrigerated and I didn't want the pan to get rancid.
customer_reviews.author: careful shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Now my egg cups look good & taste fantastic -- even my twin teenage boys noticed the difference & love them!
customer_reviews.author: Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for baby food freezing!
customer_reviews.text: Cook your home made baby food, fill the silicone pan, cover with plastic foil, place on a cutting board for better transport and freeze for 24 hours. Then take out, let stand for one minute, so the frozen portions goes out easily, pop them out with a small spoon and store in zip-bags in the freezer. When needed put in microwave for one minute and serve. Oh, so easy! No more tedious cleaning, no more small storage boxes with complicated tiny lids than can never be found. I love this product! I can even use it for cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Radovan

customer_reviews.title: very thin material
customer_reviews.text: This is ok, and it should work as expected, but it is a VERY thin product. Maybe that is because it is taller than most of the other silicon baking products that I have which seem to be much sturdier, but this one feels like the batter, if thick, will force it into a different shape when baking, and make them not round, but more oval... Just be aware it is very thin silicon.
customer_reviews.author: Carol L

customer_reviews.title: No more burnt cupcakes or muffins!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have burnt muffins anymore! I do have to use a flat cookie sheet underneath this because it needs support but cleaning is easy and my cupcakes and muffins come out perfect! Cooking time seems a bit longer but under a watchful eye this isn't too much of a problem for me. I have also been able to use liners and not use liners and remove the goods with ease. I also use this to bake egg "discs" for homemade McMuffins for my husband and they come out perfect as well!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Brinegar

customer_reviews.title: Great jumbo muffin maker!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! I use it to make jumbo egg cups or egg muffins. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't use without a support
customer_reviews.text: Quickly learned the need to use with the support of a baking sheet or pan, prior to filling and while in the oven. Wish the structure of a silicone baking tool could be sturdier/stronger.
customer_reviews.author: SMc

customer_reviews.title: This is the right stuff.
customer_reviews.text: This is the right silicone for baking you can tell by giving it a little twist and notice that the color does not fade and turn white like other brands so far I have only baked with it and the items popped out just as they should. The only problem that some might have to watch out for is if they give them a push or squeeze from behind to make sure the baked item does not get pinched. I think this mold would also be good for making good size ice cubes and candy with it too.
customer_reviews.author: Sven the Educated

customer_reviews.title: Good muffin pan!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this as I had never used a silicone baking pan before, but I'm glad I did. Everything cooks evenly and slides out easily (with proper greasing). The one thing I never considered before purchasing this, however, is that it is extremely flexible, so you need to put it on a baking sheet before putting it in the oven. Otherwise, your batter will spill everywhere and make a mess.
customer_reviews.author: ALiBeaner

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great item, very easy to clean and use, fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Marcy Duran

customer_reviews.title: Breakfast in our June oven.
customer_reviews.text: We use it for making an egg, English muffin sandwich. This pan works great! We use it in our June oven and it work very well. We’re very happy with this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Denning

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I waited so long to try the silicone muffin pan. Everything I have thrown at it releases perfectly with no added oil and leaves the pan almost clean. So far everything has cooked evenly and browned up just slightly less than a standard metal pan (which is a good thing for me). Very easy to wash since nothing sticks. As others have mentioned, best to place these on top of a cookie sheet since they flex, but that is easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable price. Easy to use and clean. Perfect for baking cupcakes. Used them for mini ice-cream pops as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sby

customer_reviews.title: Very nice muffin pan
customer_reviews.text: I like Mrs. Anderson's silicone muffin pans. They both (large and mini) work very well for muffins and candies. Very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect muffins tray
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with my purchase that I just ordered a second one.! This is the perfect size for muffins that I have been looking for. My first time using silicon muffins trays and it does the trick. Zero stick. My muffins came out perfectly and easy to get them out.
customer_reviews.author: Malena

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: It works well, but i like my metal one better. Pros - Easy to get food out. Non stick. Good size for brownies and cupcakes. Cleans easily. Stores easily. Cons - Top hardens but bottom and sides of food are moist. This can be good or bad depending on what you are making. The metal ones seem to do a better job of making the sides harder. Somewhat flimsy and I need to use a metal cookie sheet underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: melted
customer_reviews.text: Too late to return it by the time I used it . It melted at 350 degrees
customer_reviews.author: first lady

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean. Baked goods pop right out of it, no sticking. The only annoying thing is that you need to remember to put a baking sheet under it, especially if you're filling it with a liquid-y mixture - it has no structure and will flop around when you try to lift it (I've spilled plenty of muffin batter this way). Just put it on top of a cookie sheet and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: H. Barry

customer_reviews.title: This is a great invention
customer_reviews.text: I make mini-quiches, not more than bite-sized, and it's much simpler with this mini-muffin pan because there's virtually no clean-up. One of the reasons I rarely made this popular snack is because cleaning ordinary non-stick muffin pans was a big chore. But these silicone pans are wonderful. Barely running water over them cleans them very well after use. Good water-saving helper.
customer_reviews.author: maggie

customer_reviews.title: Muffins did not come out easily after following the directions
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan. Muffins did not come out easily after following the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Carmichael

customer_reviews.title: Stuck Muffins
customer_reviews.text: Followed all directions yet muffins still stuck to this silicone mold, I will go back to my search for the ultimate muffin pan, this one sure isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: coldmountain

customer_reviews.title: HIC Brands that Cook Essentials Silicone 24-Cup Mini Muffin Pan
customer_reviews.text: I am only giving this product a 3 star. Maybe it's me but when I finished baking and tried to clean, it took me quite a long time to clean. Not happy with that. I do have a 12 cup from another manufacturer and do not have this same problem. I also noticed that when I sprayed PAM in compartments for baking and then tried to clean, the silicone stayed sticky. That's another mark against this item.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Love these silicon bakeware
customer_reviews.text: Love these silicon bakeware! I use them to fix a variety of snacks and meals so that I have made ahead individual servings all ready to heat and eat. Easy to clean. Haven't use them for anything too greasy like meatloaf or anything with sausage in it. Not sure if the grease would leave a pitted "ring" around the inside.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Seaman

customer_reviews.title: Corn Toaster Cakes
customer_reviews.text: With this pan I was able to recreate Thomas's corn toaster cakes that I have missed since I left the East coast.
customer_reviews.author: A. H. Rachiele

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cuisinart toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace another silicone muffin tin that I'd melted on a hot surface. The HIC pan is sturdier (keeps shape better) and doesn't smell of rubber. It's very easy to clean, too. The sides of each muffin hole are straight rather than sloped lie my previous one, and I get much better baking results. Also, it fits (snugly) onto the tray provided with my Cuisinart toaster oven , whereas many pan (including metal) are too big. I would definitely buy other products in this line.
customer_reviews.author: Trudy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nothing sticks
customer_reviews.text: After scrubbing and scrubbing baked-on eggs from my "non-stick" muffin pan, I bought this and also silicone muffin liners (see my other review). The mini-frittatas did not stick to these, making clean up nice and easy. But, you need a cookie sheet under this for support, changing air flow around the bottom as they bake. I almost like the silicone liners better for that reason, they fit in an existing pan.
customer_reviews.author: roadkill9

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mainly for eggs. First use they popped out easily and in perfect shape. Virtually nothing stuck to the mold. Second use was entirely different. Eggs did not pop out easily and half was stuck to the cups. Trying to clean it is a major chore at this point.
customer_reviews.author: michael Scheriff

customer_reviews.title: Silicon cupcake pan
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time getting the cupcakes out. My daughter uses only this type of baking pans, and has no trouble getting the cake, cupcake or whatever out of the pans. It is nice not to have the metal rusting and staying in the food. I just have to try using them again. I feel it is a great price, great service, great product if I use them right. Nancy c
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Comello

customer_reviews.title: Silicone 12-cut Muffin Pan
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try the silicone muffin pan as my old one was over 20 years old. Make sure it is 100% silicone & do set it on a cookie sheet. The first time, I did not use paper liners, but will try them the next time I use this pan. There was no recommendation to use the paper liners, so will decide after the next batch. It is an easy care pan, which I love! I purchased one for my daughter for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Dorie M

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this muffin pan after reading reviews about ones that aren't 100% silicone and how they smell. I'm so glad I listened because this is the best little muffin pan I've had in a long time! Not only does it not smell at all, nothing sticks to it and I no longer have to use paper liners, unless I want to.
customer_reviews.author: Underwater girl

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I started Keto and I love bread. Lol. This was the perfect tool needed to make buns. I can't stop making and eating them. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for freezing single servings of veggies
customer_reviews.text: I bought the pan to help me freeze single servings of cooked veggies (1/2 cup cooked = 1 serving). I was using aluminum muffin pans, but I had to use cooking spray to coat them, and it was difficult to pop out the frozen veggies. The silicone pan, on the other hand, is flexible so I don't need to use spray and the frozen veggies pop out very easily. Glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to bake with this. I coat with coconut oil first and nothing sticks. I do put it on a baking sheet as it is flimsy but that’s expected for this type of material.
customer_reviews.author: BeachLove

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: These just weren’t for me. Ended up throwing away and ordering a regular old fashioned metal muffin pan.
customer_reviews.author: Miami17

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2-person households
customer_reviews.text: This was my first foray into silicone baking, and I LOVE it. easy to clean, dishwasher safe, food pops right out (though for cupcakes and carrot cakes, I'd still recommend using paper cups so they don't fall apart), no gross smell or taste. I'll definitely be purchasing more if I get more into baking or have to make cupcakes for a big party.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: This pan seems to be made of a heavier silicone material than what I was able to find in local home and kitchen stores. It worked great for my baking needs. Muffins released easily and in one piece. Yipee! Because these pans are very flexible I placed mine prior to filling and baking on a baking (cookie) sheet but I probably don't need to mention that. I'm enjoying my HIC Muffin Pan.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not Texas jumbo
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as large as I wanted. I was thinking it was same as texas jumbo, but these are just regular size.
customer_reviews.author: MTB

customer_reviews.title: good pan
customer_reviews.text: I use this for mini brownie muffins. They stick, but don't brownies stick to everything? I just put the whole pan in the freezer then pop them out later. It doesn't seem to get really clean in the dishwasher, but I think it's just all the nooks. I like that it's malleable. That's how I get the brownies out. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: raerae

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get baked goods out
customer_reviews.text: Easy to get my little quiches out. No sticking. Nice bright red silicone.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Ray

customer_reviews.title: Hard to handle
customer_reviews.text: I just tried to take my muffin pan out of the oven and it folded onto my finger and I got a second-degree burn. Extremely flimsy so be sure to use two potholders at all times- one on either side. Also, it smells funny and if food gets on it it won't come off.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife after she was complaining about things consistently sticking to our other muffin pan. They work splendidly! She does still put some oil/spray into the cups (I think out of habit mostly) but they have not had any sticking issues what-so-ever. Very good buy!
customer_reviews.author: jesse jay james

customer_reviews.title: Great Muffin Pan
customer_reviews.text: This is the only muffin pan I could find that stated that it was made from 100% silicone; many others I looked at said "food-grade silicone" (meaning that the percentage of silicone is high, but could still have plastic fillers). The muffins come out great, don't stick, and it's easy to clean. It's a little floppy, but I just set it on a metal cookie sheet.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Bread Comes Out With NO Issues
customer_reviews.text: My cheese buns come out with ease. Best bakeware product I’ve purchased in a while. Will definitely look at other silicone products.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Withers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have been baking mini-omelets and I was constantly having issues with them sticking to the sides of my metal pan. I decided to try this one after reading some reviews, and I couldn't be happier. This is the best purchase I've made for the kitchen--it works great, it's a snap to clean (dishwasher safe) and makes perfect little omelets every time.
customer_reviews.author: Write4Change

customer_reviews.title: Nice item
customer_reviews.text: We use this a LOT, nice item, kinda hard to clean well after a while.
customer_reviews.author: RoryM

customer_reviews.title: love this pan
customer_reviews.text: This passes the silicone "test" of bending it and not seeing any white filler. I've been using it weekly and everything pops out easily. The only thing I have yet to try is quiche or egg products! It cleans pretty easily as well. If you bake mini muffins a lot this is a TIME saver.
customer_reviews.author: meganwin

customer_reviews.title: Pops out easily
customer_reviews.text: Good size for individual breakfast quiches and soufflés to bake and freeze.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Baked Eggs / Mini Frittatas Made Easy!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! Baked eggs are no longer a hassle to clean! I don't even spray the cups and the eggs don't stick. I will probably buy one or two more for cupcake baking.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Tarkowski

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite baking took
customer_reviews.text: Not my favorite baking took. Definitely have to grease it well, but I still I struggled to get the cupcakes to pop out 100% whole. I wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great muffin pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to my growing sillicon bakeware
customer_reviews.author: browzin 1960

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good silicone quality, perfect for baking! Easy to clean and pop out the muffins. Would repurchase
customer_reviews.author: Juliet Layne

customer_reviews.title: The muffin cups are not Jumbo size, they are ...
customer_reviews.text: The muffin cups are not Jumbo size, they are standard size. They only hold approx 6 oz, and other jumbo sizes hold 8+ oz
customer_reviews.author: Richard G Schaefer

product_meta.title: Mrs. Anderson’s Baking 43629 6-Cup Jumbo Muffin Pan, Non-Stick European-Grade Silicone
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Jumbo Muffin PanMrs. Anderson’s Silicone Muffin Pan is perfect for baking muffin recipes, cupcakes, popovers, and mini cheesecakes. Made from 100-percent European-grade silicone, Mrs. Anderson’s specialty bakeware offers the same quick food release and easy cleanup as FDA-approved silicone but is even more flexible and durable to maintain its original shape and non-stick qualities through more uses. Designed with ample support to stand on its own, yet flexible enough to unmold foods with a gentle twist. Subjected to higher standards of testing for a superior food grade silicone, European-grade silicone baking pans maintain their elasticity and flexibility longer, and are stronger and more durable to withstand everyday stress and strain, like twisting to unmold and release foods, yet bounce back to their original shape. Their non-stick property is maintained through more uses than other baking molds in an even wider range of temperatures, from -40-degrees to 500-degrees Fahrenheit, for an amazing baking experience every time. Mrs. Anderson’s Silicone Muffin Pan is easy to use. Simply place it on a cookie sheet, pour in batter, and bake according to recipe. Great for baking muffins, cupcakes, popovers, mini cheesecakes, making gelatins, and more. Safe to use from freezer to oven, microwave and dishwasher. BPA free. Includes instructions. Flexible and naturally non-stick to release foods with ease. Dishwasher safe for easy cleanup. Do not use knives, scrapers, brushes or cutters. Never cut in the pan. Brought to you by HIC Harold Import Co.

BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: Mrs. Anderson’s Silicone Muffin Pan for baking muffin recipes, cupcakes, popovers, and mini cheesecakes with quick food release and easier cleanup
Higher tested European-grade silicone is stronger, more flexible and durable to maintain its original shape and non-stick qualities through more uses
Makes 6 jumbo muffins; great for muffins, cupcakes, popovers, mini cheesecakes, gelatins, and more; 11 x 7.5 x 2-Inches
Sturdy design stands on its own; flexes to pop out foods with ease; naturally non-stick for quick release; no stuck-on foods or messy cleanup
BPA free; instructions included; safe for use in the freezer, microwave and oven (to 500-degrees Fahrenheit); dishwasher safe for easy cleanup
